intro: Brachyscome ascendens, commonly known as the ascending bristlebur, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features bright yellow flowers surrounded by pale blue or white ray florets. Its leaves are narrow, hairy, and arranged alternately along the stem. Brachyscome ascendens is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats, such as coastal dunes and heathlands.
